narrative.summary: An AI Innovation Lead at AstraZeneca who sits at the intersection of biology, machine learning, and organizational strategy. With 8 years in pharma R&D operations and 5 years focused on AI strategy, they specialize in identifying which AI opportunities will actually work in a regulated healthcare environment — and building the cross-functional buy-in to get them from idea to pilot. Their distinctive value is not in building models, but in judgment: knowing what to build, what's safe to build, and how to get a 10,000-person organization to actually adopt it.
narrative.mission: I identify the highest-value AI opportunities in our enterprise, prove they work through code-assisted prototypes, and orchestrate the organization to adopt them. I bridge the gap between what's scientifically possible and what's organizationally achievable.
narrative.value_proposition: Uniquely positioned at the intersection of domains that rarely talk to each other — translating between biology and ML, filtering ideas through regulatory and feasibility lenses before investing effort, and building the trust-based relationships that convert prototypes into funded programs. In a world where anyone can build an AI prototype, the scarce skills are judgment about what to build, governance about what's safe, and influence to drive adoption. That's the core offering.
narrative.trajectory: Currently an IC-level AI Innovation Lead, building toward Sr. AI Strategy Lead (3-5 years), then Director/VP AI Strategy (5-8 years), with a long-term trajectory toward Chief AI/Innovation Officer (8-12 years). Near-term focus is on building hands-on prototype credibility (code-assisted demos with LLM APIs and agentic frameworks) while deepening governance expertise to become the enterprise authority on 'can we do this safely?'
operating_principles: The best AI projects solve a workflow pain point, not a technology gap
Cross-domain tension is a feature, not a bug — disagreement surfaces real constraints
Small pilots that prove value beat big proposals that stall in committee
'90% accuracy' is meaningless without context — what does the 10% miss cost?
The hardest part of AI in pharma isn't the model — it's the trust
domain_intersections: Biology x ML — translates between what scientists need and what models can deliver
Strategy x Technical Feasibility — filters ideas that are interesting but not achievable
Regulatory x Innovation — flags compliance constraints before they block projects at month 4
Technology x Organizational Change — understands not just what to build, but how to get 10,000 people to actually use it
Domain Expertise x AI Judgment — when AI prototyping is commoditized, deep domain knowledge + strategic judgment becomes the differentiator
challenges_they_solve: R&D scientists can describe biology but can't articulate AI feasibility — helps them surface what an ML model would actually need from their domain
Data scientists propose elegant technical solutions that don't solve real pain points — bridges the gap between 'interesting model' and 'useful tool'
Cross-functional constraints (regulatory, IT infrastructure, data governance) are invisible until they block a project at month 4 — surfaces them early
60% of time spent translating between domains — structuring that translation to free up time for strategy
AIXplore generates more ideas than can be evaluated — building faster evaluation without losing rigor

current_skills.name: AI/ML Strategy
current_skills.why: Core to the mission — evaluating which AI opportunities are worth pursuing and which will be obsolete in 3 months

current_skills.name: Project Portfolio Management
current_skills.why: Manages the AIXplore portfolio of simultaneous AI bets — fund, kill, or pivot based on evidence

current_skills.name: Cross-Functional Facilitation
current_skills.why: The mechanism for surfacing invisible constraints across biology, ML, regulatory, and IT teams before they block projects

current_skills.name: Stakeholder Communication
current_skills.why: Converts technical AI possibilities into business cases that VP sponsors fund — the bridge between prototype and investment

current_skills.name: Drug Discovery Workflow
current_skills.why: Domain context required to evaluate whether AI solutions actually address real workflow pain points in pharma R&D

current_skills.name: Data Governance & Compliance
current_skills.why: Healthcare is regulated — knowing data constraints early prevents projects from stalling at the compliance gate

current_skills.name: AI Business Case & ROI Modeling
current_skills.why: The skill that converts 'interesting prototype' into 'funded program' — critical for the trajectory toward AI strategy leadership

current_skills.name: Pharmaceutical R&D Landscape
current_skills.why: Deep pharma context is what makes AI opportunity identification credible — without it, you're proposing solutions to problems you don't understand

current_skills.name: Regulatory Awareness (FDA/EMA)
current_skills.why: Regulatory constraints are hard constraints — knowing them early is the difference between a viable project and a 4-month waste

current_skills.name: Clinical Trial Design (Concepts)
current_skills.why: Required context for evaluating the Clinical Trial Success Predictor and similar pipeline projects

current_skills.name: Cross-domain translation (biology ↔ ML)
current_skills.why: The core differentiator — most people speak one language, this role requires fluency in both to surface what's actually feasible

current_skills.name: Constraint-first evaluation
current_skills.why: Maps blockers before investing effort — prevents the most common failure mode in enterprise AI projects

current_skills.name: Executive storytelling
current_skills.why: 3-minute pitch for every prototype, speaking in outcomes not technology — the skill that gets ideas funded

current_skills.name: Trust-based influence
current_skills.why: Building the sponsor relationships that convert ideas into investments — influence without authority in a matrixed organization

Cross-functional coordination, stakeholder alignment, constraint surfacing
Endpoint concepts, trial phases, regulatory awareness
Model evaluation, explainability requirements, data quality assessment
FDA/EMA submission awareness, GDPR data governance

career.title: AI Innovation Lead
career.focus: AIXplore portfolio, cross-functional AI project evaluation

projects.name: Compound Screening ML
projects.outcome: In pilot, showing early results on small molecules

learning_goals.goal: Build 3-5 code-assisted prototypes (LLM APIs + agentic frameworks) to develop intuition
Complete AI business case architecture framework for enterprise pitches
Study NIST AI RMF + FDA AI/ML guidance to become the 'can we do this?' person
Deepen understanding of clinical trial endpoints and statistical design
Learn enough about transformer architectures to evaluate feasibility claims
Study successful AI deployments in pharma (case studies, failure modes)
Build a repeatable constraint-first evaluation framework (using PAI)
Build a cross-industry AI patterns library (fintech/retail to pharma translation)
Study organizational change management for AI adoption (Prosci or equivalent)

seeking: Deep ML technical feasibility assessment mentorship
